newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah little changed in sleepy trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah little changed in sleepy trade.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was little changed against the dollar in sleepy late trading on Wednesday, with liquidity remaining ample, dealers said.
"It was a quiet day. Major speculation was only on the intervention band," one local bank dealer said.
He said the market did not move at all after the central bank kept its fixing unchanged late on Wednesday.
Dealers said sentiment remained firm on the rupiah, with no turnaround for the dollar seen in the near-term.
Spot rupiah was quoted at 2,324.0/24.3 at 0905 GMT against an opening of 2,324.20/25.20.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,323.75/24.10 and 2,324.15/24.35, respectively.
The local bank dealer said the dollar might then rebound when interest rate differentials between the two currencies were so narrow that holding the rupiah was no longer attractive.
Overnight money was last traded at around 8.5 percent in the afternoon, compared with an opening of 11.0 percent.
Overnight swap was at 0.30/0.35 and tom/next at 0.40/0.45.
Dealers said liquidity was expected to remain flush on Thursday because many operators had rolled-over excess money with overnight central bank papers (SBIs).
Another local bank dealer said offers by the central bank of SBIs at eight percent helped lift interest rates after overnight money fell to a low of seven percent in the morning.
Longer-term swaps were still under light pressure, but the local bank dealer said further downside was limited.
"I think it has bottomed out for now," the dealer said.
One-month swap was at 16.75/17.5, two at 33.5/35.0, three at 50.75/52.50 and six at 98.25/99.25 points.
The central bank kept its intervention rate at 2,324/2,516 and the conversion rate at 2,324/2,372 on Wednesday.
